Initialized(uint64).details: Triggered when the contract has been initialized or reinitialized.

params.consumedItemId: Item required to augmentation, it will be destroyed

increaseRevision(address).details: Revision should be increased on each contract upgrade

isController(address).details: Return true if given address is controller

itemFragility(address,uint256).details: [0...100%], decimals 3, so the value is in the range [0...10_000]

registerItem(address,((uint8,uint8,uint8.details: It's possible to reduce size of the contract on 1kb by replacing calldata=>memory (+2k gas)

repairDurability(address,uint256,uint256.details: Repair durability of the item with {itemId} by destroying {consumedItemId}

repairFragility(address,uint256,address,.details: If you have no space in this contract you can remove this function and use useOtherItem instead

params.item: Fragility of this item will be reduced. Initial fragility must be > 0

params.data: Data required by other item, encoded by abi.encode Format of the data depends on the other-item-subtype: REDUCE_FRAGILITY_1: (address item, uint itemId)     item - the item which fragility should be reduced USE_GUILD_REINFORCEMENT_2: (address hero, uint heroId, address helper, uint helperId)     hero - the hero that asks the guild reinforcement     helper - the hero staked in guild reinforcement which help is desired EXIT_FROM_DUNGEON_3: (address hero, uint heroId)     hero - the hero that is going to exit from the dungeon REST_IN_SHELTER_4: (address hero, uint heroId)     hero - the hero that is going to have a rest in the shelter of the guild to which the hero's owner belongs

combineItems(uint256,address[],uint256[].notice: Combine multiple {items} to single item according to the given union-config

controller().notice: Return controller address saved in the contract slot

incBrokenItemFragility(address,uint256).notice: SIP-003: The quest mechanic that previously burned the item will increase its fragility by 1%

isGovernance(address).notice: Return true if given address is setup as governance in Controller

itemFragility(address,uint256).notice: SIP-003: item fragility counter that displays the chance of an unsuccessful repair.

reduceDurability(address,uint256,uint8,b.notice: Reduce durability of all equipped items except not-used items of SKILL-type

repairFragility(address,uint256,address,.notice: Reduce fragility of the {item} on the value taken from metadata of the {consumedItem}. Destroy the consumed item. New fragility = initial fragility - value from metadata.

tsFirstAugmentation(address,uint256).notice: SCR_1263: Timestamp of first augmentation moment. 0 - if either the item was not yet augmented OR it was augmented before implementation of SCR_1263. Augmentation cannot use protective item in second case.
